column4: Does anyone know how I can change the theme of my KDE apps from within Gnome? I don't have KDE, just lol
damn
lol went in the wrong window
I meant to say, I don't have KDE, just a few KDE apps in Gnome
uhh qt config program the name escapes me
I'll look for that
how 'bout qt4-qtconfig?
sounds good
it should be nosmp
thanks
hyperthreading doesnt mean something uses half vs all of the cpu
doesn't it basically "emulate" a dual-cpu machine, dividing the processor "in half"?
it's merely a slightly better way to utilize the CPU's resources.  in most cases.  it is not perfect and it will be slower in niche cases
sort of but it's weidr
things always use <50% of the cpu with ht enabled
hmm it's sort of just splitting the cpu but all the power is still there.  hard to explain i suppose. i dont really know the mechanics of it
i think it shortens the cpu pipeline
ok, either way I've established that disabling it helps me encode video faster :)
digits, nuked_ome1, Ext2 IFS CAN write Ext3
digits, nuked_ome1, just not with journalling, so you'll have to fsck the drive if windows crashes
I'm confused... what's kilobits then?
kbits usually.  nobody uses it much
if you see kb/s in a program, it's kilobytes per second almost undoubtedly.
file a bug if you'd like it renamed
I think I shall
there's only one #
have you tried virtualbox? I found it a lot easier to set up... and it's free.
i have not tried it.  it didnt not work on 64bit
thou now that i have a 32bit host i'll give it a shot.  i'd have to use xp32 though as a guest, which seems slower than xp64 for me
ok. It's nice though :)
it's really nice for 32-bit stuff. Easy UI, free, some people say it's faster than vmware
well interesting
the open source version isn't great.
but the closed version is free
yep
installed on Feisty with .run file. giving it a shot
they have a .deb!
edgy/dapper not feisty
ah.
post install scripts
ok. So by that logic, couldn't nvidia-glx run nvidia-xconfig themselves?
they could but it's messy.
ok, what about an nvidia-easy package or something?
they could.  though feisty takes care of it nowadays
i have a problem with feisty taking care of it... if you modify your xorg, it gets angry at you.
it gets feisty does it?
i dont know i havent tried it :)
it does :)
neither have I, but I've heard it does... I haven't had to touch it because I'm running in a VM with no acceleration :)
did you have problems getting VBox to run initially?
i added my user to vboxusers group.  still no luck
I had to add my user to vboxusers, i think that was it.
try running as root, see if it works then.
i'd rather not but i'll tryt
i wouldn't try it...
root = dangerous :)
but you know that.
VBox won't run your existing vmware VMs...
i know that
i created anew
if you have VBox VMs, make sure that not only are they in ~/, but they're also not owned by root.
you need to reboot after the vboxusers trick
actually it is on /media/sda3, owned my Andy atm
restarted gdm.  group seems to appear when i type in bash (it didn't earlier).  i assume i'm in the group atm
i did
lol, xbox 2?
are you using the server version?
feisty 7.04 desktop
you can just set automatic ntp updates from the GUI, no? I have it set up that way...
that doesn't work me (nor does doing it manually)
previous ubuntu versions and feisty beta were fine.  im not sure what's up with this install
that's really screwy... i have no idea.
yea it's kinda weird.  is there a way i can log which cron tabs are executed?  i need to verify that the crontab is running properly
you might check the system log
klog is empty with regards to cron
check all the logs, I use Anacron (laptop) and all its stuff is in sysleg.
hm..is 'sudo crontab -e' anacron?
I have no idea... I don't use cron
not at all
ah how do i make an anacron job?  i'll just try that
cron only runs stuff at the times you set
anacron lets you set things in day intervals, and it'll run them whenever possible
ah i might need to make it run more often than once a day
it gets run on boot, but needs to be called if the computer's going to be on for longer than your interval, but cron actually calls anacron every day.
your computer's clock is that bad?
i guess.  at least on this install it is.  i have no idea
that's really messed up... have you tried reinstalling? Maybe some file is messed up
yeah a bit uncomfortable with reinstalling atm.  some custom RAID setups i dont want to lose
if my hwclock is fine, what's up though?
can't i just sync gnome clock to hwclock?
i have no idea
i'm using a custom kernel with tickless support.  maybe that's screwing it up
i think i read about clock drift with realtime patches, not sure though
I dunno, I'm not at the custom kernel level of linux use :)
